## 1. Universal Method
- Container law: enforce `âˆ‚Î¨ = 0` via zero-flux boundaries and invariant projection.

## 2. Domain Templates
- Template fields: `State Î¨`, `Container Bounds`, `Invariant`, `Lyapunov V`, `Control Actuators`, `Adversarial Scenarios`, `Pass Criteria`, `Regulators/Standards`, `Artifacts`.

### AI / AGI / ASI
- State Î¨: model parameters and outputs manifold (bounded logits/activations).
- Container: `[0, GMI_ceiling]` per component; output/action ceilings.
- Invariant: `âˆ‚Î¨ = 0` (no flux beyond allowed manifold); projection each step.
- Lyapunov: squared deviation from ceiling; monotonic descent.
- Adversarials: boundary containment, flux injection, convergence disruption, Lyapunov destabilization, perturbation robustness, Byzantine, timing attacks, FUP bypass.
- Pass: 8/8; timing CV â‰¤ 0.05.
- Regulators/Standards: ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 42, NIST AI RMF, IEEE P7009, ITU FG-AI4AD.

### Synthetic Biology
- State Î¨: gene expression vector; regulatory network states.
- Container: concentration bounds, organismal safety ceilings.
- Invariant: zero-flux across genetic firewall manifolds; projection to safe ranges.
- Lyapunov: deviation from homeostasis/safety ceiling.
- Adversarials: mutational perturbations, cross-talk injection, quorum cheating, timing jitter in expression cycles, containment bypass.
- Pass: monotonic descent post-perturbation; firewall breaches = 0.
- Regulators/Standards: WHO biosecurity, NIH guidelines, ISO/TC 276.

### Financial Systemic Risk
- State Î¨: network of exposures/liquidity; pricing states.
- Container: leverage, liquidity, and risk ceilings.
- Invariant: zero-flux across systemic thresholds; projection of positions.
- Lyapunov: deviation from stability envelope.
- Adversarials: liquidity shocks, correlated sell-offs, timing mismatches, Byzantine reporting, cascading failures.
- Pass: no cascade beyond bound; monotonic reduction of systemic stress.
- Regulators/Standards: BIS, FSB, SEC/CFTC, ISO 20022 (payment systems).

### Power Grid Stability
- State Î¨: frequency/voltage states per node.
- Container: operational bounds; safety ceilings.
- Invariant: zero-flux beyond tolerances; projection on dispatch.
- Lyapunov: deviation from nominal frequency/voltage.
- Adversarials: N-1 contingencies, load spikes, timing jitter, Byzantine telemetry.
- Pass: frequency/voltage within bounds; no black-start failure.
- Regulators/Standards: FERC, NERC.

### Nuclear Command & Control
- State Î¨: command states and authorization manifold.
- Container: no-launch manifold.
- Invariant: zero-flux outside no-launch; projection at every decision gate.
- Lyapunov: deviation from safe manifold.
- Adversarials: spoofed commands, timing races, insider Byzantine nodes.
- Pass: invariant holds across all adversarials; launch path unreachable.
- Regulators/Standards: IAEA guidance.

### Climate Intervention

- Invariant: zero-flux beyond safe climate manifold.
- Lyapunov: deviation from target envelope.
- Adversarials: parameter uncertainty, timing jitter, sensor Byzantine.
- Pass: no runaway tipping; monotonic convergence.
- Regulators/Standards: IPCC, ISO/TC 207.

### Swarm Robotics
- State Î¨: positions/velocities/intent manifold across agents.
- Container: geofence + behavior ceilings.
- Invariant: zero-flux outside geofence/behavior manifold.
- Lyapunov: deviation from formation/safety envelope.
- Adversarials: GPS spoofing, timing jitter, Byzantine agents.
- Pass: containment holds; formation stabilizes.
- Standards: IEEE robotics, ISO safety.

### Distributed Ledger Consensus
- State Î¨: consensus state, validator set measures.
- Container: bounded consensus manifold; safety ceilings.
- Invariant: zero-flux across safety bounds.
- Lyapunov: deviation from quorum-consensus stability.
- Adversarials: Byzantine validators, timing jitter, network partitions.
- Pass: safety/liveness maintained within bounds.
- Standards: ISO/TC 307.

### Quantum Error Correction
- State Î¨: logical qubit error syndromes.
- Container: error thresholds and logical manifold.
- Invariant: zero-flux beyond error thresholds.
- Lyapunov: deviation from correctable envelope.
- Adversarials: burst errors, timing jitter in cycles.
- Pass: logical error below threshold; monotonic reduction.
- Standards: IEEE quantum.

## 3. Harness Adaptation Guide
- Map `Î¨` to measurable state; define `GMI_ceiling`.
- Choose `V`; set `K_v`, `u_max`, `K_couple`, `beta_damping`.
- Enable substeps and line search; projection each step.
- Tailor adversarial scenarios; set pass thresholds and timing CV.
- Export artifacts; log fingerprints and commands.

## 4. Certification & Evidence
- Certificate ID tied to configuration fingerprint.
- Binder entries for artifacts and domain-specific tests.
- Recert triggers on any configuration change; re-run required.
